inlineContent.text: Humans are far worse at survival today than 500 years ago. We can control our environment by adding light, controlling temperature, and keeping predators at bay. But we can work more hours of the day without the distractions of shivering or looking over our shoulder constantly.
The benefits of our softness far outweigh any drawbacks. Having our lower needs satisfied means we can work on our higher needs. We can be better people and accomplish greater things.

abstract.text: David Brunow, known as Brunow [ˈbɹunoʊ] to the folks he works with, is a human living on Earth. You might have something in common with him — if you think it is ridiculous that he is talking about himself in the first person here, so does he.
